name: Targeted Threat Intelligence (TTI) #2 - Sharing Intelligence
description:
| Phase | Step | Outcome |
| ------------- |:-------------:| -----:|
| Targeted Threat Intelligence | 2 of 5 | Understanding of the`Entity` through sharing intelligence process between the CTI team of the `Entity` and the CTI team of the TI Provider |

# Tasks

- `Task #1 - Sharing Intelligence`

# Sharing Intelligence

During this activity of the Targeted Threat Intelligence phase, the goal is to better understand the threats that the `Entity` is working on. For achieve this, is necessary that both CTI teams work togheter to share knowledge. If the `Entity` hasn't CTI team, the sharing will be with the internal cybersecurity team or external cybersecurity team.

Sharing can be done in different formats, either technology structured format or reports made by `Entity`. When the sharing is finished, the TI provider must correlate the information received with previously stored intelligence to identify possible correlations from previous exercises.

# Outcome

The outcome of this case is generated intelligence by the TI provider about those threats that the `Entity` did any investigation in the past. This intelligence is needed by the case #3.

tasks.title: Task #1 - Sharing Intelligence
tasks.description:
# Dependencies

This task has dependency on case `Targeted Threat Intelligence (TT) #1 - Context`, since the information gathered in that case will be used in this task. 

# Goal

Your goal here is share knowledge and intelligence with the CTI Team or cybersecurity team of the `Entity`. It is highly recommended to share the information in two ways
- Using structured formats
  - STIX objects
  - MISP events
  - Atomic Tests
  - OpenIOC objects
  - etc..
- Reports documents made by `Entity`

The intelligence gathered can be useful for the next cases, since you will correlate information about threats observed by the `Entity` and you.
